alert.note: Alert for Hertford; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON...NORTH CENTRAL HERTFORD...ISLE OF WIGHT...EASTERN SOUTHAMPTON...YORK...SOUTHEASTERN JAMES CITY...SOUTHEASTERN GLOUCESTER...MATHEWS...AND EASTERN SURRY COUNTIES...THE CITY OF POQUOSON...THE WEST CENTRAL CITY OF NORFOLK... THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF HAMPTON...THE CITY OF NEWPORT NEWS...THE CITY OF FRANKLIN...THE WESTERN CITY OF PORTSMOUTH...THE CITY OF SUFFOLK AND THE CITY OF WILLIAMSBURG THROUGH 1215 AM EST... At 1129 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from Scotland to near Ivor to near Boykins. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Williamsburg, Franklin, Courtland, Surry, Queens Lake, College Of William And Mary, Ivor, Jamestown, Grove, and Hunterdale around 1135 PM EST. Newport News, Gloucester Point, and Suffolk around 1140 PM EST. Smithfield, Gloucester Courthouse, Windsor, Isle Of Wight, Fort Eustis, Lee Hall, Hayes, Wicomico, and Carrsville around 1145 PM EST. Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences and Denbigh around 1150 PM EST. Mathews, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Mobjack, Rescue, Achilles, and Blakes around 1155 PM EST. Christopher Newport University, Tabb, Beaconsdale, and Gwynn around 1200 AM EST. Hampton and Bavon around 1205 AM EST. Northampton around 1210 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Vicksville, Pons, Carrollton, Lackey, Chippokes State Park, Beulah, Moon, Longview, Laban, and Camp Peary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
